description:
Bring serious power to off-grid adventures, without the noise or fumes of a generator. Lots of port options for charging your devices: 12V (car cigarette lighter), USB or AC wall plugs. Power almost anything, from DSLR batteries, to TVs and fridges.

  • Charge time 3 hours from USB PD, 8.5 hours from wall charger, 12–24 hours from the Boulder 50 solar panel
  • Plug battery into a power source during storage, or fully-charge every 3-6 months
  • Peak capacity is 505Wh (10.8V, 46.8Ah) and lasts through hundreds of cycles
  • Charging and low-battery protection built-in
  • AC inverter “wall plugs” accept grounded and ungrounded plugs (output, pure sine wave): 120VAC, 60hZ, 2.5A (300W continuous, 1200W surge)
  • 2 USB ports (regulated output): 5V, up to 2.4A (12W max)
  • USB C port (regulated output): 5¬/9V, up top 3A (18W max)
  • USB PD (regulated input and output): 5–20V, up to 3A (60W max)
  • 12V car port (regulated output): 12V, up to 10A (120W max)
  • 6mm port (regulated output): 12V, up to 10A (120W max)
  • Charging port (regulated input, 8mm): 13-22V, up to 10A (120W max)
  • LCD power status display and battery charge capacity
  • Provides pass-through power, plug into the wall and plug device into the Yeti, so device stays charged if the power is out
  • Operating temp is 0-40°C
name: Goal Zero Lithium Yeti 500X Portable Power Station
